TopicTitle: Can I find the old versions of KSP?

Articles.Content:
I realize I should have probably been hoarding the old versions of the game (since I've been with it since the early days) but I never thought I would want to engage in nostalgia over it. But here we are... Is there a way I can find all of the previous versions of KSP? As far back as 0.14, pre-minmus days. Back when the physics engine was wonky as all hell and getting to the Mun was a REAL challenge.

I also ask due to a... slight worry on my part. I do trust Squad very much, and I'm sure they will most likely go on to make the game better and better. But... there is always a risk that version 0.95 will have some terrible thing added that I hate. And if that does ever happen, I like the notion that I can have a stockpile of the old versions.

Edited January 12, 2015 by PTNLemay

Too bad you didnt post this last week...

I had been hoarding every version since 0.17...I JUST deleted them all last week, while cleaning up lots of old KSP installs, saves, crafts, mods, and all the other junk I ended up collecting...

You DO have me thinking i probably should have thrown at least a few of the old versions on DVD, though...
This topic may be relevant to your interests.
Everybody realizes that they should of been hoarding them, and then feels sad.

This topic may be relevant to your interests.

That's a good start, thanks!

You'll find that getting your hands on copies of versions after the 0.13.x series is very difficult (well, except for 0.18.3, the current demo), as those are all technically pay-to-play releases. Some of us do have the older pay-to-play versions, but we're not allowed to distribute them.
Europa Universalis IV actually does this through Steam... Squad pls.
KSP has Previous Stable Release option in that manner, Nitrous. But yeah, having old versions available probably wouldn't hurt.

Yeah, I saw on the official site that they have 0.90 as well as 0.25, which is a good start. But I thirst for more!

Hopefully as the game moves beyond the big 1.0 they'll ease up on defending the 0.1x versions.
